questions.question_text: Which AWS service provides protection against DDoS attacks for applications that run in the AWS Cloud?

discussion.content: B - AWS Shield provides protection against DDoS attacks for applications that run in the AWS Cloud.

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B. AWS Shield. AWS Shield is a managed DDoS protection service that safeguards applications that run on AWS against the most common DDoS attacks. It provides always-on detection and automatic inline mitigations that minimize application downtime and latency, so there is no need to engage AWS Support to benefit from DDoS protection.

questions.question_text: Which option is a perspective that includes foundational capabilities of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Letter B. The other options are related to Well-Architected Framework

B, Security. The AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF) provides a perspective that includes foundational capabilities for organizations to securely and compliantly adopt AWS. This includes security controls and compliance with industry standards and regulations.

Selected Answer: B
The AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) includes five perspectives that help organizations to organize their efforts when adopting AWS. These perspectives are pillars of a cloud adoption program and represent a set of priorities that organizations must consider when moving to the cloud. The five perspectives are: Business,People,Governance,Platform,Operations.

Each of these perspectives includes several key areas and best practices, and together they form a comprehensive framework for organizations to use when planning their cloud adoption. The option that represents a foundational capability of AWS CAF is "Security," which is a key consideration in all aspects of cloud adoption.

Correct - Security is one of the foundational capabilities of the AWS CAF. The other foundational capabilities include Cost Optimization, Operational Excellence, Reliability, and Performance Efficiency.

(B) AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM). IAM is always available free of charge to AWS users and enables you to manage access to AWS services and resources securely. You can use IAM to create and manage AWS users and groups, assign permissions to users and groups to access AWS resources, and configure multi-factor authentication (MFA) for added security.

Selected Answer: B
B. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) is always available free of charge to users

B, AWS Snowball Edge allows for offline data transfer, storage, and processing, making it suitable for environments with limited internet connectivity.

Selected Answer: B
The AWS service that can meet the requirements of local data processing on premises and operate without a stable internet connection is AWS Snowball Edge. Snowball Edge is a data transfer device with on-board storage and compute power that can be used to perform local processing tasks on data before transferring it to AWS. It is designed to operate in disconnected environments and can be shipped to the AWS region once the data processing is completed.
